definitions.text: the act of catching an object with the hands
examples: Mays made the catch with his back to the plate
he made a grab for the ball before it landed
Martin's snatch at the bridle failed and the horse raced away
the infielder's snap and throw was a single motion

definitions.text: a spell of cold weather
examples: a cold snap in the middle of May

definitions.text: tender green beans without strings that easily snap into sections
a crisp round cookie flavored with ginger
the noise produced by the rapid movement of a finger from the tip to the base of the thumb on the same hand
examples: servants appeared at the snap of his fingers

definitions.text: a sudden sharp noise
examples: the crack of a whip
he heard the cracking of the ice
he can hear the snap of a twig

definitions.text: a sudden breaking
the tendency of a body to return to its original shape after it has been stretched or compressed
examples: the waistband had lost its snap

definitions.text: an informal photograph; usually made with a small hand-held camera
examples: my snapshots haven't been developed yet
he tried to get unposed shots of his friends

definitions.text: a fastener used on clothing; fastens with a snapping sound
examples: children can manage snaps better than buttons

definitions.text: any undertaking that is easy to do
examples: marketing this product will be no picnic

definitions.text: the act of snapping the fingers; movement of a finger from the tip to the base of the thumb on the same hand
examples: he gave his fingers a snap

definitions.text: (American football) putting the ball in play by passing it (between the legs) to a back
examples: the quarterback fumbled the snap

definitions.text: utter in an angry, sharp, or abrupt tone
examples: The sales clerk snapped a reply at the angry customer
The guard snarled at us

definitions.text: separate or cause to separate abruptly
examples: The rope snapped
tear the paper

definitions.text: break suddenly and abruptly, as under tension
examples: The pipe snapped

definitions.text: move or strike with a noise
examples: he clicked on the light
his arm was snapped forward

definitions.text: close with a snapping motion
examples: The lock snapped shut

definitions.text: make a sharp sound
examples: his fingers snapped

definitions.text: move with a snapping sound
examples: bullets snapped past us

definitions.text: to grasp hastily or eagerly
examples: Before I could stop him the dog snatched the ham bone

definitions.text: put in play with a snap
examples: snap a football

definitions.text: cause to make a snapping sound
examples: snap your fingers

definitions.text: lose control of one's emotions
examples: When she heard that she had not passed the exam, she lost it completely
When her baby died, she snapped

definitions.text: bring the jaws together
examples: he snapped indignantly

definitions.text: record on photographic film
examples: I photographed the scene of the accident
She snapped a picture of the President
